classes.name: Fighter
classes.description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

features.name: Second Wind
features.description: You have a limited well of stamina to protect yourself.

subclasses.name: Champion
subclasses.description: Focuses on raw physical power honed to deadly perfection.

features.name: Improved Critical
features.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

features.name: Remarkable Athlete
features.description: Add half your proficiency bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution checks.

pros: Simple and effective - great for new players
Expanded critical hit range increases damage output
Self-healing with Second Wind
Excellent survivability with high AC and HP
Versatile - works with any fighting style
cons: Limited tactical options compared to other subclasses
No magical abilities or utility spells
Can become repetitive in combat
Fewer out-of-combat abilities
bestFor: New players learning the game
Players who prefer straightforward combat
Tank builds focused on survivability
Damage dealers who want consistent performance
subclasses.playStyle: Straightforward melee combatant focused on dealing consistent damage and surviving on the front lines

subclasses.name: Battle Master
subclasses.description: Employ martial techniques passed down through generations.

features.name: Combat Superiority
features.description: Learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

features.name: Student of War
features.description: Gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools.

pros: Highly tactical with many combat maneuvers
Versatile - can adapt to different situations
Great battlefield control options
Superiority dice add strategic resource management
Excellent for experienced players who like options
cons: More complex than Champion - requires planning
Limited uses of maneuvers per short rest
Can be overwhelming for new players
Requires good knowledge of positioning and tactics
bestFor: Tactical players who enjoy complex combat
Leaders who want to support allies
Players who like resource management
Characters focused on battlefield control
subclasses.playStyle: Tactical combatant who uses special maneuvers to control the battlefield and support allies

classes.name: Wizard
classes.description: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You have a spellbook containing spells that show your true power.

features.name: Arcane Recovery
features.description: You can regain magical energy by studying your spellbook.

subclasses.name: School of Evocation
subclasses.description: Focuses on magic that creates powerful elemental effects.

features.name: Sculpt Spells
features.description: You can protect allies from your area-of-effect spells.

features.name: Potent Cantrip
features.description: Your damaging cantrips affect even those who avoid the brunt of the effect.

pros: Excellent damage output with evocation spells
Sculpt Spells prevents friendly fire
Potent Cantrip ensures cantrips always deal some damage
Empowered Evocation adds Intelligence to damage
Great for blaster builds focused on damage
cons: Limited utility compared to other schools
Focused primarily on damage dealing
May struggle in social encounters
Fewer defensive options than abjuration
Can be one-dimensional in playstyle
bestFor: Players who want to be the party's primary damage dealer
Those who enjoy blasting enemies with fireballs
Characters focused on battlefield control through damage
Players who prefer straightforward spellcasting
subclasses.playStyle: Destructive spellcaster focused on dealing maximum damage while protecting allies from collateral damage

races.name: Elf
races.description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in places of ethereal beauty.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply for 4 hours a day.

subraces.name: High Elf
subraces.description: High elves are graceful warriors and wizards who originated from the realm of Faerie.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with longswords, shortbows, longbows, and shortswords.

traits.name: Cantrip
traits.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list.

traits.name: Extra Language
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.

pros: Free wizard cantrip provides magical versatility
Intelligence bonus great for wizards and artificers
Weapon training gives martial options to casters
Extra language aids in social encounters
Excellent for gish (warrior-mage) builds
cons: Intelligence bonus less useful for non-caster classes
Weapon training may be redundant for some classes
Cantrip uses Intelligence, may not scale well
Less specialized than other elf subraces
bestFor: Wizards and other Intelligence-based casters
Eldritch Knights and other gish builds
Characters who want magical and martial options
Players who enjoy versatile characters
subraces.playStyle: Versatile character combining martial prowess with arcane magic, excellent for hybrid builds

subraces.name: Wood Elf
subraces.description: Wood elves have keen senses and intuition, and their fleet feet carry them quickly through their forest homes.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with longswords, shortbows, longbows, and shortswords.

traits.name: Fleet of Foot
traits.description: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when only lightly obscured by foliage.

pros: Wisdom bonus excellent for druids, clerics, and rangers
Increased speed provides tactical mobility
Mask of the Wild enables stealth in natural environments
Weapon training includes longbow proficiency
Perfect for nature-based characters
cons: Wisdom bonus less useful for non-Wisdom classes
Mask of the Wild only works in natural settings
Weapon training may overlap with class proficiencies
Less versatile than High Elf's cantrip
bestFor: Rangers, druids, and clerics
Characters focused on archery and stealth
Nature-themed campaigns and characters
Players who enjoy mobility and stealth
subraces.playStyle: Swift, stealthy character at home in natural environments, excellent archer and scout

races.name: Human
races.description: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races.
languages: One additional language of your choice

traits.name: Extra Skill
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

traits.name: Extra Feat
traits.description: You gain one feat of your choice.

subraces.name: Variant Human
subraces.description: Some humans are born with exceptional abilities.

traits.name: Skills
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

traits.name: Feat
traits.description: You gain one feat of your choice.

pros: Free feat at 1st level provides significant customization
Flexible ability score increases fit any build
Extra skill proficiency adds versatility
Can take powerful feats like Great Weapon Master early
Excellent for optimized builds
cons: No special abilities like darkvision or resistances
May feel 'boring' compared to exotic races
Smaller total ability score bonuses than standard human
Relies heavily on feat choice for uniqueness
bestFor: Optimized builds that benefit from early feats
Any class that wants specific feat synergies
Players who enjoy customization and flexibility
Characters focused on mechanical optimization
subraces.playStyle: Highly customizable character that can excel in any role through careful feat selection and ability score placement

spells.name: Fire Bolt
spells.description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

spells.name: Mage Hand
spells.description: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. You can use your action to control the hand.

spells.name: Prestidigitation
spells.description: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of several magical effects within range.
